revised_title: Description and Analysis of Two Unique Plants from the Cape of Good-Hope
tldr: Dr. Sloane presents two plants from the Cape of Good-Hope, describing their unique features, including their leaves, cones, seeds, and fruit. The first plant, called the Silver Pine, has leaves covered in white silk-like hair and cones with seeds lodged between scales. The second plant has brown smooth bark, thickly set leaves with no foot-stalks, and fruit made up of many hard, red scales enclosing rudimentary seeds. These plants are of great interest for their beauty and for their potential to propagate and spread.
